issue.title: Allow 2-way-sync

labels.name: feature: sync and upload
labels.description: Syncing or uploading (that isn't auto upload specific)

issue.body:
When 'syncronizing' a folder in the nextCloud app, actually changes from the remote server become propagated on the mobile device. However changes on the mobile device aren't uploaded back to the remote server.

How the nextCloud app should behave:
- files added to a synchronized folder should be scanned/recognized
- changes to files (create, update, delete) of a synchronized folder should be propagated back to the server
- conflicting changes should open a dialog (overwrite on device/server, rename)

comment.body: Never mind the money. I just want this issue resolved and don't understand why it's not a priority. I've tried to ask @karlitschek on X.com but I never get an answer.

issue.title: Second Modification to File Via Storage Access Framework Fails

labels.name: needs info
labels.description: Waiting for info from user(s). Issues with this label will auto-stale.

issue.body:
### ⚠️ Before posting ⚠️

- [X] This is a **bug**, not a question or an enhancement.
- [X] I've [searched for similar issues](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues) and didn't find a duplicate.
- [X] I've written a clear and descriptive title for this issue, not just "Bug" or "Crash".
- [X] I agree to follow Nextcloud's [Code of Conduct](https://nextcloud.com/contribute/code-of-conduct/).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Import a databse to KeePassDX on Android that is stored on Nextcloud
2. Make a modification to the database using KeePassDX (successful)
3. Attempt a second modification (fails)

### Expected behaviour

The second modification should be synced to the Nextcloud instance as well.

### Actual behaviour

KeePassDX displays an error, which, according to the developers of KeePassDX is a problem with Nextcloud, as it "breaks the write permissions on the second opening of the file with the same URI". See [this issue](https://github.com/Kunzisoft/KeePassDX/issues/1444).

### Android version

13

### Device brand and model

 ‎‏‏‎

### Stock or custom OS?

Stock

### Nextcloud android app version

3.24.1

### Nextcloud server version

25.0.3

### Using a reverse proxy?

I don't know

### Android logs

_No response_

### Server error logs

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
> @TechD123 & @fuzunspm - Can you confirm that this issue no longer occurs in >=v3.26 per #11286?

sorry I missed the notification but I no longer use KeepassDX but I re-installed it to test and it worked

issue.title: Make local owncloud folder visible to other applications

labels.name: needs info
labels.description: Waiting for info from user(s). Issues with this label will auto-stale.

issue.body:
### Actual behaviour
I am using AndrOpen Office.
When saving a new document I got offered (see first screenshot) to store to the Local Drive (which is a subdirectory to /storage/emulated/0/myapplication...).
Additionaly I got the possibility to save my file in the dropbox or the "Other Cloud Storage" 
![savedocumentto](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5901190/20868535/1fca0754-ba5e-11e6-8312-2211c46ebea5.png)


- which is the directory of the Cirrus App (also an owncloud client).
![lastused-afterothercloudstorage](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5901190/20868536/2861714a-ba5e-11e6-8241-be03ebc12b35.png)

The NextCloud folder is missing here...)

### Expected behaviour
I would like to see the nextCloud folder too here.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a new document with AndrOpen Office
2. Save the document


### Environment data

Android version:
7.0

Device model: 
Nexus 9

Stock or customized system:
stock

Nextcloud app version:
20161129-beta

Nextcloud server version:
10.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```

issue.title: Expose persistent storage links to external Apps
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I have a Keepass database in my Nextcloud and i am using KeePassDX on Android to use it.
When selecting a database from within KeePassDX, a "file chooser" opens, Nextcloud can be selected from the sidebar just fine and everything works as intended.
The problem is that the Nextcloud app apparently returns a storage link which is only good for a single use. For each subsequent time i want to access the database, i have to go through either the file chooser or the Nextcloud app again. KeePassDX has a list of recent databases (and a default database), but using them just gives a 'file not found'. This is a known error and described in their [FAQ](https://github.com/Kunzisoft/KeePassDX/wiki/FAQ#why-do-i-see-an-error-asking-me-to-re-open-the-database-file-from-my-file-browser) and [here](https://github.com/Kunzisoft/KeePassDX/wiki/File-Manager-and-Sync).

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be great if Nextcloud could offer persistent links to KeePassDX. Alternatively, maybe someone can elaborate on why it is not possible and what a good alternative solution could be.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I have tried multiple file browsers in order to open the database through them, some of them apparently gave persistent links but none of my previous workarounds are working anymore, hence i am looking for a proper resolution.

issue.title: Expose persistent storage links to external Apps
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I have a Keepass database in my Nextcloud and i am using KeePassDX on Android to use it.
When selecting a database from within KeePassDX, a "file chooser" opens, Nextcloud can be selected from the sidebar just fine and everything works as intended.
The problem is that the Nextcloud app apparently returns a storage link which is only good for a single use. For each subsequent time i want to access the database, i have to go through either the file chooser or the Nextcloud app again. KeePassDX has a list of recent databases (and a default database), but using them just gives a 'file not found'. This is a known error and described in their [FAQ](https://github.com/Kunzisoft/KeePassDX/wiki/FAQ#why-do-i-see-an-error-asking-me-to-re-open-the-database-file-from-my-file-browser) and [here](https://github.com/Kunzisoft/KeePassDX/wiki/File-Manager-and-Sync).

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be great if Nextcloud could offer persistent links to KeePassDX. Alternatively, maybe someone can elaborate on why it is not possible and what a good alternative solution could be.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I have tried multiple file browsers in order to open the database through them, some of them apparently gave persistent links but none of my previous workarounds are working anymore, hence i am looking for a proper resolution.

comment.body:
Closing due to both #8336 covering this and a lack of follow-up info.

Note, there was also #10168 so there may have been other causes for this over time.

issue.title: Allow accessing downloaded documents while offline through SAF
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I want to switch from Keepass2Android to KeepassDX, which relies on the storage access framework. Unfortunately, even when the file is downloaded and available through the Nextcloud app, even though it is visible in SAF, trying to open or copy it will result in an error.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Allow opening these files. Modifying it might not be possible, not sure if Nextcloud has a 2 way sync system like on desktop.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
* Keep using Keepass2Android which has native WebDAV sync support
* Use some sync tool
* Open the file from Android/Media

issue.title: Allow accessing downloaded documents while offline through SAF

### Describe the solution you'd like
Allow opening these files. Modifying it might not be possible, not sure if Nextcloud has a 2 way sync system like on desktop.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
* Keep using Keepass2Android which has native WebDAV sync support
* Use some sync tool
* Open the file from Android/Media

comment.body: As far as I can tell this enhancement request came in 3 days after this functionality was released in v3.18. It was implemented in #8925.
